reporting-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs

title.narrative: Food securing and living conditions Improving for newly internally displaced people in northern Syria.

description.narrative: To address the food needs of vulnerable IDP households in North-West Syria, WATAN’s project is designed to be flexible in responding to the dynamic changes on the ground, relying on a variety of modalities according to the different contexts. Interventions will aim to scale up and complement the ongoing response, including WATAN’s existing reception center in Idleb (Marrat -Tamasrin), which provides an emergency first aid response to the needs of the huge flow of IDPs coming from Idleb’s countryside and western Aleppo, and also to the established camp in Akhtrin, Azaz (Aleppo). The reception center is already fully functioning, and it provides FSL, WASH, Health, Protection and Shelter/NFI services to 160 HH/ 800 individuals each three days. The camp is already established and it can host 500 HH/2,500 individuals. WATAN is proposing a comprehensive and integrated food response consisting of the following activities: 1- Distribution of 41,280 cooked meal to serve 6,880HH / 34,400 individuals in Maarat Tamasrin reception center Each HH will receive a cooked meal twice a day for three days 2- Provision of re-allocation services for 3,440 HH / 17,200 individuals We are expecting that 50% of the total targeted BNFs will need transportation from WATAN reception center to a CCCM approved camp. For this reason, we are providing re-allocation services for 3,440 HHs upon coordination with WATAN’s shelter/NFI staff, existing partners and CCCM cluster. 3-Provision of 20,640 RTE rations to 6,880HH / 34,400 individuals WATAN will distribute food vouchers for those IDPs that are transferred to CCCM approved camps. That way, IDPs will be able to receive RTE rations 3 times for 3 weeks, in line with the FSL cluster recommendation and WFP kits designing procedures. 4-Provision of 2,000 food rations to 500HH / 2,500 individuals at WATAN’s camp In cooperation with WATAN’s shelter/NFI team, WATAN’s FSL team will support WATAN camp in Akhtrin/ Azaz/ Aleppo with food kits for four months (one kit/HH per month). The camp is able to host 500HH / 2,500 individuals and will receive IDPs coming from our reception center. 5% of the beneficiaries of our project are people with special needs. The proposed project aligns with the 2019 HRP objective “ To provide life-saving humanitarian assistance to the most vulnerable people to alleviate suffering”, as well as the FSL sector objective “Improve the food security status of assessed food insecure people through life-saving and life-sustaining food assistance”. It is aligned with allocation strategic objective (ASO), 3 of “Provision of emergency services in and out of camps through food assistance and livelihoods”, which include the prepositioning and distributing of ready-to-eat-rations (RTER), food baskets, and cooked meals to respond the basic needs of newly displaced IDPs. This project IDPs’ food access will be ensured through the most appropriate transfer modality, taking into account the agency of IDP households and their specific needs, as well as the guidance provided by the FSL Cluster.

receiver-org.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs
